intro: Erigeron pinifolius, commonly known as the pineleaf fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as prairies, meadows, and woodland edges. Its leaves are needle-like, giving it a distinctive appearance similar to pine needles, and it produces small white to pale blue flowers in the summer. Erigeron pinifolius is often found in dry soils and is adapted to a variety of environmental conditions.
